intro: Trujanoa mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican trujano, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces small, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Trujanoa mexicana is considered a rare and endangered species.
